page.title: 11Housing in Cilcain
page.content: The old buildings of the area were mostly constructed of local stone with slate roofs. Some have been occupied for centuries, although many have now been modernized and extended, while a few, like the old village smithy, have been converted for residential use. Most new development has taken place in the village, which has expanded greatly in recent years. In 1947 some timber-faced, semi-detached council houses were built for local people to rent: more recently detached houses of brick or rendered block-work with tiled roofs have been built for owner- occupation and some bungalows have been provided for local pensioners. Little further building will be allow- ed,so that the village will retain its rural character, and the picturesque old village centre is now protected by designation as a 'conservation area'.
